name: Overview
data:
[{"id":"ff1681a2-e971-4bfb-abb7-e98697714c8b","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Class Documentation: ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ReturnItem","styles":{"code":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"f1f66f1e-5621-4a07-9c06-722bed607556","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"The ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ReturnItem","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" class is a data container (or "Data Transfer Object") that represents a single point of data exit and entry. It is the fundamental unit stored within the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ReturnManager","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":". While the manager handles the organization, the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ReturnItem","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" holds the specific details of a single assignment resulting from a function return.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"a15ff2e4-332a-4be5-814b-4088e55137ad","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"7b02ae75-bc8e-4897-a591-1b3e540822af","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":4,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Attributes","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"3cbdd388-9f81-4e1a-a2ea-1d6f4dcf8b38","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"left","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"any","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"): Represents the "Left-Hand Side" (LHS) of an assignment. This is typically the name of the variable that is receiving the return value (e.g., in ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"x = func()","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"left","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":""x"","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":").","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"53369e56-c5e7-43bf-b2c9-71488ffa8337","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"row","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"int","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" / ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"str","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"): The specific line number in the source code where the return or assignment takes place. This acts as a unique coordinate to distinguish between multiple calls to the same function within a single scope.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"c3fe3948-f948-4661-8c6b-fb81c7d21126","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"right","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"str","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"): Represents the "Right-Hand Side" (RHS) origin. This identifies the source of the value, usually the namespace or function name providing the data.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"2419994f-c740-427b-9ef2-5856395b8254","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"51aae26d-1c01-4ebe-b362-fbe86c10ef20","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":4,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Methods","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"f6e39f61-cdc4-4a23-94be-e8406bb380af","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"__init__(left, row, right)","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" Constructs a new return record. It maps a destination (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"left","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":") to a source (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"right","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":") at a specific point in the code (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"row","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":").","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"473ff05f-e04a-4ab1-8471-e5e1f826693b","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"a6101442-cd9f-4216-aa79-1b102e969561","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Usage Example","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"16061699-f1c8-4d1b-ae24-809c73a044a0","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"While ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ReturnItem","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is usually instantiated automatically by the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ReturnManager.add_returnitem","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" method, it can be used independently for modeling data flow:","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"c437110a-558d-4a18-871b-7387dc2d404d","type":"codeBlock","props":{"language":"python"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"from returns import ReturnItem

# Representing the code: result = calculate_total() at line 125
# Where 'calculate_total' is part of the 'finance' module
item = ReturnItem(
    left="result", 
    row=125, 
    right="finance"
)

# Accessing the item attributes during analysis
print(f"Analysis Point: Line {item.row}")
print(f"Data Flow: {item.right} -> {item.left}")

# Example Output:
# Analysis Point: Line 125
# Data Flow: finance -> result","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"61d5b072-d9f2-4754-9f33-8698b199950c","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Relationship to the System","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"2f3ddade-b352-4272-b5b7-cba257c835ef","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Granularity","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": By storing the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"row","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", this class allows Jarvis to handle complex logic where the same variable might be reassigned by different function returns in the same namespace.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"8eadd611-3e51-4c91-8ea8-ade825c418a4","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Traceability","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": It serves as the "bridge" between two distinct code locations, allowing the analysis engine to maintain a continuous chain of evidence for how a value moved from Function A to Variable B.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"edb9ffb3-c967-4645-a3be-6b84f654df72","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[],"children":[]}]
